name: Hilton Palm Springs Resort

reviews.text: My only complaint was not being able to check into my room until 6pm- Hilton did upgrade me to a Junior Suite and it was a very nice room with a pool view- would have been nice to have had one of the renovated rooms, though. The room was clean and a great size, but the TV was old and difficult to maneuver in the armoire. The beds was very comfy- the staff incredible. Spent some time at the pool bar and the staff was friendly and accomodating. I would stay here again- in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.text: Just spent 4 nights @ Palm Springs Hilton for the AOPA Annual Summit. Hotel is conveniently located just one block and easy walking distance to the Convention Center. The Hotel is very large and extensive and depending on where your room is located can be quite a hike from the lobby. Signage in the lobby wasn't that great considering its sprawling footprint. It is a nice 3 story hotel and my room was on the 2nd floor with a balcony overlooking a magnificient pool area. Room was clean and well appointed although the renovated wing (at least from the outside) looked very nice. Towels were generous and soft and the bed was very comfortable. The TV's need upgrading in this day of inexpensive flat screens. It was an older, smaller analog TV with terrible picture and reception. Room was very quiet with no issues. Lobby was appointed very nicely and the staff was very friendly and courteous. The pool was basically empty all of the time but the staff at the pool was helpful, even offering to "make up" a lounger chair for me. Drinks are availabe at the pool which makes things very nice. Parking is an extra $12 per day for self parking and $18 for valet. I thought this was a bit expensive since Palm Springs is an expansive area. Overall a pleasant stay although for a bottom line price of about $230/night I would think that there might be some nicer options from the other hotels that I walked through.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel Close To Convention Center
Needs renovated; charming staff!!
reviews.text: I recently attended the AOPA pilots mtg being held at the PS Convention Center. This hotel was about 2 blocks away, so perfect for that. However, I was disappointed in the room. I had a Jr Suite, which was quite spacious, but very old decor. The bathroom door had a hole that looked like it had been repaired several times instead of just replacing the door. The mattress left a lot to be desired; needed flipped or replaced! I am recovering from a knee replacement 6 weeks ago & slipped & fell in the tub. While not the hotels fault, a non-slip mat, or skid strips would've been nice! The hotel mgr on duty was very nice when I notified her of the incident upon checking out. The lady running the gift shop on Fri eve was very pleasant & chatty. We had a wonderful discussion! The front desk staff were all very cordial. The place just needs a face lift. I understand part of the hotel has been completed from others attending the meeting talking about their hotels & comparing notes. As a Hilton frequent member, I was surprised compared to other properties. I was not able to use other amenities there (pool, balcony, futness ctr, etc) just due to time factor with my meeting schedule.

We spent five wonderful days at the Hilton and we were very fortunate in being in one of their renovated rooms.  We choose the Hilton due to being a pet friendly hotel.  Our room was extremely comfortable and very clean, with access to the beautiful pool.  We had excellent service from all staff members.  When I travel I always take my girls, a Westie and a miniature Schnauzer with me.  It was so wonderful to be in a room that did not have an order.  One of the evenings we opt to go out for dinner and needed a sitter for my girls.  Hilton suggested Molley from Happy Trails.  I cannot say enough about the wonderful care that was given to my girls. I did try to schedule a message but could not get through nor leave a message with their office.  I am looking forward to returning back to Palm Springs in February and staying at the Hilton.
reviews.title: 5 days in Palm Springs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a flagship brand this Hilton was a definite disappointment to say the least. The hotel apparently is being renovated piece by piece. Too bad the room we stayed in wasn't one of the renovated rooms - instead I felt like I stepped back a decade or two. The room was clean - no issue there but the air conditioner was noisy, the TV a throwback to when a 24" tube was a big deal, the couch was visibly stained as was part of the ceiling. The bathroom was not a real problem - it was large enough but it has been years and years and years since I have stayed in a hotel where the temperature in the shower went up and down and up and....
reviews.title: More attention to detail needed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No problem with value and room, but the we could easily hear conversations from the rooms next to us and people walking around above us amplified like a herd of buffalos. The only way to enjoy relative peace in an old hotel design like this one, is to get a top floor room and make sure you do not have an adjoining room door connecting two rooms. Without relative peace and quite no hotel is worth it.
reviews.title: Paper thin walls.

reviews.text: I have stayed in a number of Hilton hotels and this was by far the worst experience I have ever had at a Hilton property. There are a lot of extra charges (nickel and diming) for everything -- parking, breakfast, use of business lounge, use of resort, etc. which people really hate. And the service, particularly the front desk, was terrible. Rooms are motel quality. We were very disappointed and would not recommend this property. Look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Select Another Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here since we were attending a conference at the conference center. It's only a couple of blocks away, which made it really convenient. It is also only a couple of miles from the airport, so it's a very convenient location.
reviews.title: It's Okay...

reviews.text: This hotel is old. Not shabby, but in need of a facelift. It looks nice from the outside, but you can tell how it is dated by some of the fixtures, decor, etc. (The antique hair dryer still on the wall was one of my favorites!) :) The room was comfortable, but you can tell it's been through a few remodels where cosmetic patch work was done (old screw holes in walls, scuffed paint, drooping plaster).
reviews.title: The others are worse.

reviews.text: Self-parking is $10/day and $15 for valet. They offer a shuttle to the airport, which was great. The outside pool bar has drinks and food available - for a price. $8 for each drink. The downtown is 2 blocks from the hotel - walk there for dinner.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights with my husband while he was on a business trip. The hotel was undergoing extensive renovation so it's a little difficult to accurately judge the grounds and services since most were unavailable. You can tell the property was in desperate need of a facelift because most everything was dated so I think the renovation is a good thing.
reviews.title: Slightly above average compared to other hilton properties

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had already completed its renovation, and as Diamond status we were upgraded to a suite. The room was extremely spacious and came with a king-sized bed, desk, and sectional sofabed and coffee table in the seating area. You can comfortably sleep 4 in the room. The bathroom was a nice size and the lighting was ample. The quality of construction seemed unfinished, however. There was a large cracked tile in the shower, many of the wall tiles were not flush with each other and there was a clump of grout in the corner of the shower that should have been cleaned during construction.
reviews.title: Best value and location in P.S.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room overlooked the pool and had a huge deck that would have been perfect during spring and summer. The pool was under construction so all we heard were jackhammers and construction workers but I'm sure it will be lovely when completed.
reviews.title: Open During Construction, but they shouldn't be.

reviews.text: We received breakfast vouchers during our stay and I found the breakfast to be quite good. I used the fitness center once and I would consider it only average. There are cardio machines and some free weights. However, if you are tall you will probably not like the fitness center because the ceiling is extremely low. You might not even fit on the elliptical machine, in fact.
reviews.title: even though they are renovating it is very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part about the hotel is its prime location in Downtown Palm Springs. It's walking distance to all of the great shops and restaurants as well as the Thursday night street fair/farmers market.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location
Affordable and centrally located hotel - no frills
reviews.text: We do a girls trip every year to Palm Springs. Last year, we stayed at Hotel Zoso which was a fantastic experience - chic, centrally located, great service, spacious rooms, etc. However, their prices went up so we decided to stay at the Hilton this year. I usually favor boutique hotels over chains, but I must say, I was pleasantly surprised with this Hilton in Palm Springs. We stayed in one of the renovated rooms and it was really nice/clean. Great shampoo/soap brand. Attentive pool service. While the hallways were a bit rundown/smokey, it wasn't that big of a deal. And, we were a short walk to the main shops/restaurant strip. I think we'd consider staying here again in the future based on price and proximity.

Recently, we stayed at the Hilton Palm Springs Resort. The hotel layout is great, we had a room with a view of the pool for a good price. After arriving, we understood why it was such a great deal. The hotel is going through a renovation. Once it is complete, I would definitely upgrade my rating to Very Good. Based on location and value, if you desire a weekend in the desert this hotel is great. Close to restaurants, theatre, shopping, and the Palm Springs Art Museum. The spa at the hotel looks great as well. Definitely, give it a try. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Diamond in the rough...

reviews.text: This was the headquarters hotel for a small conference I attended, so I stayed there. While the basics are there, and the cost was relatively reasonable, service and maintenance left a fair amount to be desired
reviews.title: Good location but run down and so so service

reviews.text: - When we arrived, the door/parking staff was in disarray, slow, inefficient, not knowledgeable. The one young doorman/parking attendant asked if we wanted help with our bags. When I said yes he got a shocked look on his face and said he'd have to go find us some help and a cart. Every time we went out there it was the same story: the door was under, often not staffed and when there was a man there he was always poorly trained, seemingly stressed, and unable to help with the most basic questions (directions, locations of major downtown streets, restaurants, landmarks)
reviews.title: Needs Work

reviews.text: - In all the times I went in and out there was never anyone at the door
reviews.title: Nicely renovated
Excellent stay
reviews.text: Very Pleased with the service. Front desk was very courteous, knowledgeable along with the housekeeping staff. I will be returning to stay here again and believe I get my moneys worth, Thank you for the great service, it goes a long way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at Hilton during holiday. Arrived on Thanksgiving day to Buffet near the entry way so decided to give it a try. I was disapointed; food luke warm at best. Definelty not worth the 29.95 per person. They do offer you breakfast coupons for the hotel but make sure you only get the American breakfast so that it ensures you a nearly free breakfast less tip and taxes. Rooms are very clean as I read reviews to ask for a renovated room, which is a must. Bed's comfortable and linens nice. If your room is on the second floor makes sure its not under the Presidential suite on the 3rd as we it sounded like a hurd of elephants and we asked to move part way into the night. They accomadated us nicely. We were moved from a pool view to a non pool view which worked out fine as the atmosphere in general was quite. On a travels we stopped at a IMAX theatre in Cathedral city. 70MM screen was well worth the ticket price for 2 of $30. It was a popular place. We had lunch across the street from Hilton at Sherman's Deli. Finally a hot turkey dinner at an excellent price!!! Fresh hot bread, real mashed potatoes and the turkey was delicious. There's always a line for this place but there service was very quick so we were seated in a timely fashion.
reviews.title: Good location, very clean but Hotel restaurant not worth it

reviews.text: Palm Springs downtown itself is old a many stores gone and out of business. Even the stores that are left have display windows that look like they are 30 years old. One window even had medium sized stuffed toy animal like you would win from the fair and it was marked $60. Something tells me they will be out of business soon too. Who are these stores marketing too? A great place for shaved ice and ice cream is a small shop with handmade icecream on the strip. This is my first overnight stay in this city and can't say there is much here to draw me back unless I'm just in need of getting out of our local June gloom one summer. There is a movie theatre within walking distance so going to go check that our for another new release. Good news is I was in much need of a layed back stress free break and that's what this old town gives you but not much else (unless maybe you're a golfer)
reviews.title: One of the best!

reviews.text: Parking: Valet $18 a day and Self parking is $12.
reviews.title: Frequent Stay in Palm Springs

reviews.text: This Hilton is definitely one of the best Hilton I ever stayed in! Got upgraded to the Presidential suite, so you can imagine that I loved it. Stayed here already a couple of times and over all every time was perfect,
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did a risky piece of travel planning I never do which is use priceline! Proven wrong for $45 we got the Palm Springs Hilton. This place is a big 1970's PS resort with on the recent renno con's. The room was good with excellent bed/linen which was a surprise. The fact we could park next to room was added bonus. Although I would not stay here again (rather the ACE/Viceroy) I thought this was a great hotel for famiies who want a break out of Los Angeles. Huge pool with plenty of chairs/space and very well priced hotel menu.
reviews.title: A priceline gem for 24hrs for families!

reviews.text: My two sisters and I stayed here on a Friday, Saturday, and departed on Sunday (not a Holiday weekend). We got a not bad rate from the Hilton website and decided to go with this place regardless of all the negative reviews on TA.com due to it's location (close to Palm Canyon). Upon check-in we asked for a room with a pool view even though we did not reserve for one and got out request free of charge from the person at the front desk. I had to initial a few places acknowledging that the hotel was a pet-friendly hotel. I did NOT have to sign something saying about not partying in the hotel room etc contrary to what the other reviews said. Nor did we have to wear a "wristband" the whole time either. We declined to get parking which was $8 a day since parking was ample and free of restrictions all day right on the street! Saved us some money right there!!!
reviews.title: Great place to stay to get away for a quick getaway with friends.. do not trust what others say about this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyhow, upon entering the room we were pleasantly surprised to see how nice the room looked and how spacious it was. It didn't have a plasma tv but who cares since the room and bed was comfy enough. There were cable channels like TLC, MTV, HBO, ESPN, etc to watch when relaxing in the room which was a pretty cool touch. The lamp on the nightstand didn't turn on but all the other lamps perfectly well so we just left it as-is. The bathroom had a separate area to powder your face and the bathroom itself had one sink which had pretty ample space to put all your belongings on. The toilet at one point didn't flush, but I called the front desk and within literally minutes someone was up to our room to fix the problem. Now that's great service! I wish the room had a mirror in the bedroom area but I guess since the powder area had a mirror there PLUS mirrors on the sliding closets they probably decided it wasn't needed. Also, we had a balcony which of course faced the pool area which was nice. Although, on Saturday when the pool was it's busiest there was a group of ladies that were a bit loud at times and we could hear it pretty well even though the sliding door was shut. The walls and ceiling were a bit thin. You could hear people talking in the hallway and people running above us, but it wasn't so bad since it was mostly quiet during our stay.
reviews.title: TIRED!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We once ate at the hotel's restaurant called the Terrace I believe for lunch. We were seated by the windows facing the pool area which was nice so you can people watch while you eat. It was a little stuffy in there but I think that was because it was a covered patio (just wish it was a bit cooler in there since it was so hot outside). I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich which came with your choice of salad or fries. The chicken was grilled deliciously and came with lettuce, tomato, onions, and pickle. I was given an overload of yummy fries. Our server was also very attentive and friendly and got our order just the way we wanted it. Also, I want to note that the menu had a vast variety of dishes from pizza, to pasta, sandwiches (which were all decently priced) to higher priced entrees. I definitely would HIGHLY recommend eating here since it is convenient and the food is GREAT.
reviews.title: do not come here with your family on a holiday weekend!!!!

reviews.text: The pool was very big and had a big shallow section were you could either wade or swim as you please. Like I had said earlier, the busiest day was on Saturday. There were a group of older ladies there celebrating one of their birthday's that got a bit rowdy at times, families with their small children, couples, and groups of mixed friends which kept to themselves. Everyone was able to get a nice spot to sit or lay out which was a huge plus for me. There was one person going around taking orders for food since they had that option which was nice (this was present to me on a Sunday but not on the busy Saturday). One tiny thing which was missing was some outdoor music of some sort. One person had brought their own radio or boombox which kind of helped the atmosphere a little. Of course it was not to everyone's taste but it was better than nothing. All in all it was a pretty good pooling experience.
reviews.title: Category 5 Hotel? No Way!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Palm Springs in February 2010 for two nights, while attending a conference that was being hosted at the hotel. The room was OK for the purpose I needed (attending the conference during the day and doing a little work from my room), but I definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place to stay on vacation. While the hotel has several meeting rooms, they are located in various places of the hotel and it is somewhat inconvenient to walk from the ballroom to smaller meeting rooms.
reviews.title: I stayed because I was attending a conference - I wouldn't go back

reviews.text: Guest rooms are spacious but dated, with 80s decor and some repairs badly needed. For example, rooms have sliding wood doors over the windows with louvered-window shutters, but when I tried to adjust one of the louvers, several slats fell off their hooks and onto the floor. For those who are unable to sleep without a total blackout, you may also find this challenging, as there are no curtains. The bathroom was clean but also dated, and the sofa and chair in the room had faded and stained upholstery. The bed was a notable exception, with a very comfy mattress and pillows, and nice, soft linens. I definitely slept well, although the walls are thin and I was able to hear my neighbor's TV until well past midnight on the 2nd night.
reviews.title: Needs Updating

reviews.text: On a positive note, the pool area is quite nice, and the front desk and room service staff were very friendly. I asked for a late check out to do work and was able to stay in the room until 2pm, and both the dinner and breakfast I ordered from room service was good.
reviews.title: Two star hotel at 5 star pric

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I would recommend finding an alternative hotel in Palm Springs for the price if you have a choice. If you conference is being hosted there...it probably will work for you.
reviews.title: A Cheap Tube TV with picture quality from the 70s!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay at a LOT of Hiltons and this one needs refurbishing badly. Especially for the rate they charge.
reviews.title: Convenient hotel in a nice city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hotel was over run with drunken thugs who assaulted a guest and threatened his friends. not enough security to handle 30 thugs. police responded after an hour with 6 officers in order to arrest 2 of the thugs.[they arrived batons in hand] the remaining thugs continued drinking, spitting and cursing untill 5 am in the central jacuzzi. the hilton had the assaulted guests leave for their own safety rather than eject the thugs. seems hilton puts profit before the safety and comfort of decent people. discovered that this group of thugs stays at hilton palm springs every major holiday. according to locals the thugs were involved in a shooting downtown palm springs last year... stay there at your own risk!
reviews.title: never again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location 2 blocks from the strip and right next door to a Casino. We were upgraded to a jr suite. It was a fairly large room with a nice balcony overlooking the pool. It's a little older, but very well maintained. The restaurant looked nice, but I didn't eat there so I can't comment on the food. Service was great, I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: I just stayed at the Hilton Palm Springs Resort last night and I wanted to make sure I got a review written right away. After reading the Trip Advisor reviews, I was very nervous about booking this hotel. But I can tell you first hand that this was truly a first-rate Hilton property.
reviews.title: Perplexed by the Bad Reviews

reviews.text: The Grounds / Location:
reviews.title: Causual, relaxing, easy walk to strip

reviews.text: The hotel grounds are impeccably clean and beautifully landscaped. Gorgeous flowers, fresh cut grass, and lush greenery abound. The hotel lobby was spotless and the parking lot was also very, very clean. I felt very safe here. The location is fantastic - it is literally across the street from a casino and is a short two block walk from the charming downtown area. Lots of cute local eateries and shops. The hotel is centrally located so you can really walk around Palm Springs if you stay here. A great choice if you want to have a pitcher of margaritas and don't want to drive!
reviews.title: Great Service and Rates High

aka: Hilton Palm Springs Hotel Palm Springs
description: Hilton Palm Springs offers a perfect combination of location, amenities and distinctive service. Located in downtown Palm Springs, our resort features premium accommodation including 59 suites, 33,000sq ft special event space, Elements Spa luxury day spa and a variety of dining options including Al Fresco our poolside bar and grill. Whether you are traveling on business or looking for a peaceful retreat, the Hilton Palm Springs can provide you with the ultimate desert hotel experience.
